description.narrative: This project aims at supporting the returning IDPs and host communities. The goal is to ensure the humanitarian needs are met, but to also contribute in the rebuilding of lives and livelihoods.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

4.1. 4 targeting and verification activities have been conducted 4.2. One prototype design of a rural house with low cost has been built 4.3. One document has been developed on disaster damage and loss. It includes eligibility criteria and identification of the poorest of the poor households who lost their homes 4.4. 2104 IDP house construction materials including industrial products and poles have been purchased and made available to IDPs who have used them to construct their damaged houses. 5.1. 5400 vulnerable farmers have received improved seed varieties based on their seed of choice and are currently engaged in food production 5.2. 60 cooperatives of IDPs and communities have been established and organized in place of return into groups and supported with: poultry, bee keeping, animal fattening, and other locally viable initiatives. Technical training and financial assistance have been provided to them. 5.3. 540 women in group-based savings, micro-finance or lending program with their average annual savings through VSLA activity (savings through groups) have been established

4.1 HLP – Identify and then support prioritized Housing Land and Property right related activities 4.2 Assess and document lesson learned from the construction of houses of returnees /host communities 4.3 Deployment of an international expert for technical assistance for programme development and resources mobilization to ensure the continuity of funding for the Gedeo and west Guji recovery project. UNDP covers only 12 % of the cost and the rest to be met by other agencies. 5.1.
